principle.name: Design System First
principle.description: Always establish design tokens and CSS custom properties before implementing components
principle.rationale: Ensures consistency across all UI elements and makes maintenance easier

example.good: Define colors, spacing, and typography variables first
example.bad: Hard-code values directly in component styles

principle.name: Mobile-First Responsive Design
principle.description: Design for mobile devices first, then enhance for larger screens
principle.rationale: Ensures optimal experience on all devices and prevents mobile issues

example.good: Use fluid typography with clamp() and mobile-first breakpoints
example.bad: Design desktop first and add mobile fixes later

principle.name: Accessibility by Default
principle.description: Build accessibility features into components from the start
principle.rationale: Reduces remediation costs and ensures inclusive user experience

example.good: Include ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, and focus management

convention.rule: Use CSS custom properties for all design tokens
Use semantic HTML elements with proper hierarchy

pitfall.why_problematic: Violates WCAG guidelines and makes content hard to read
pitfall.correct_approach: Use contrast checking tools and ensure 4.5:1 ratio minimum

pitfall.why_problematic: Excludes users who cannot use a mouse
pitfall.correct_approach: Test all interactive elements with Tab key and implement proper focus management

pitfall.description: Fixed widths instead of responsive units
pitfall.why_problematic: Content doesn't adapt to different screen sizes
pitfall.correct_approach: Use percentages, viewport units, and fluid typography

category.name: accessibility
category.item: All interactive elements support keyboard navigation
Semantic HTML with proper ARIA labels

category.name: performance
category.item: Loading and error states are handled
